de.systemagmbh.tools.logger
Class CSysDefaultLogger

java.lang.Object
  de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.ASysLogger
      de.systemagmbh.tools.logger.CSysDefaultLogger
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISysComponent, ISysDevelopmentLogSwitch, ISysGlobal, ISysLog, ISysLogConstants, ISysLogger
public class CSysDefaultLogger
extends ASysLogger

The CSysDefaultLogger is the default implementation of an ISysLogger. Its componentName is 'CSysDefaultLogger'. The CSysDefaultLogger is simply calling the checker, the formatter and the writer in this order if its log method is called.

The expected configuration must contain the following items:
Checker The 'checker' item must contain the parameter 'class' containing the name of the class of the checker that has to be used and the complete configuration of the checker itself.
Formatter The 'formatter' item must contain the parameter 'class' containing the name of the class of the formatter that has to be used and the complete configuration of the formatter itself.
Writer The 'writer' item must contain the parameter 'class' containing the name of the class of the writer that has to be used and the complete configuration of the writer itself.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Udo Friedrich, Torsten Knauft

init

public void init(ISysConfigItem configItem)
          throws ASysException
Initialise the logger object with the specified logger parameters.

Parameters:
configItem - The parameters for running the logger as ISysConfigItem.
Throws:
ASysException - if something goes wrong

log

public void log(String componentType,
                Object toBeLogged,
                int level,
                Properties prop)
This method defines the way, how a logger will format the log output.

Parameters:
componentType - The name of the application part that called the log method.
This is used for the component log levels!
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
toBeLogged - The object that has to be logged.
level - The level that is used for logging the given text.
(May be empty if the concret implementation does not need this information.)
prop - The parameters for formatting this log output as Properties. These parameters are not set for all the following log outputs. (Use method setProperties for this.)

close

public void close()
